did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Earl Gregg Swem Library, College of William and Mary
did.abstract: Typescripts of letters, 1862-1865, written by Marshall M. Miller of Battery F, First Michigan Regiment, Light Artillery to his wife, Adelia M. Miller. Includes descriptions of camp life in Ohio, Kentucky, Tennessee, North Carolina and Georgia and descriptions of battles in the Atlanta Campaign.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: Typescripts of letters written by Union soldier Marshall M. Miller (b. 1827) of Battery F, First Michigan Regiment Light Artillery to his wife Mrs. Adelia M. Miller at Bethel, Branch County, Michigan. Includes descriptions of camp life in Ohio, Kentucky, Tennessee, North Carolina, and Georgia.

Starting in August 1864, Miller participated in engagements in the Atlanta campaign and there are descriptions of these battles. Also, forms about his military service filled out by Miller in 1873 for the Adjutant General's Office, Military Department, Michigan, and a typescript of a letter, 29 March 1903, from J. T. Miller, Union City, Michigan, about the history of the Miller family of Branch County, Michigan.

arrangement.head: Organization
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into two series. Series 1 contains forms and Series 2 contains letters.
